title: Projects
text:

Interactive dashboard for entering, mapping, and analyzing small mammal trapping data.

Tools: R Shiny, leaflet, RSQLite

Features: real-time GIS mapping, summary statistics, species heat maps

Code: GitHub Repo
Live App: RatTrapHistoryApp

title: Projects

title: About
text:
Hi ‚Äî I‚Äôm Timothy, an ecologist turned data scientist with a passion for building tools that drive a deeper understanding of data, particularly when it comes to conservation and the environment. My journey began with ecological data collection from small mammal trapping, electro-fishing, to plant diversity surveys evolving into designing clean database schemas, predictive dashboards, data management and QA systems that empower teams to visualize data and make data-backed decisions.
I love wrangling messy ecological field data, designing visual workflows for conservation agencies. I‚Äôve worked with federal agencies, research institutions, and cross-functional technical teams ‚Äî always aiming to improve clarity, utility, and insight.
I believe good data tools should be intuitive, adaptable, and easy to understand. Most recently, I‚Äôve been exploring Big 12 recruiting data for basketball and football programs and creating plot visualizations via R.
Oh, I also love ultra running and long hikes with my pups!

title: About
text:
üåø Interests & Focus üåø

Ecological data pipelines and interactive tools
R Shiny dashboards, SQL databases, and QA automation
Visual storytelling through data (ggplot2, Quarto, Plotly, Leaflet)
Data visualizations of recruit classes from 247 sports (along with web scraping)

title: Home
text:

If you‚Äôre a researcher, developer, or agency looking to bridge technical insight with ecological relevance please reach out :)
